title: Universal Praise
shortSummary: Psalm 117 is the shortest chapter in the Bible, calling all nations and peoples to praise the Lord for His steadfast love and enduring truth. It emphasizes God's mercy and faithfulness as the foundation for worship that transcends cultural and national boundaries.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to King David

keyCharacters.name: The LORD
keyCharacters.description: The sovereign God of Israel, whose merciful kindness and truth endure forever, and who is the rightful recipient of universal praise.

definitions.definition: A translation of the Hebrew word 'chesed,' meaning steadfast love, covenant loyalty, and faithful mercy shown by God toward His people.
Refers to God's faithfulness, reliability, and unchanging promises that endure forever.
An act of worship expressing reverence and adoration toward God for His character and deeds.

outline.heading: Call to Universal Praise
outline.description: The psalmist invites all nations and peoples, not just Israel, to praise the LORD, highlighting the global scope of God's reign and the inclusiveness of His salvation.

outline.heading: Reason for Praise: God's Mercy and Truth
outline.description: The psalmist explains that God's great merciful kindness and enduring truth are the reasons for universal praise, affirming God's unchanging character and covenant faithfulness.

application: Recognize that God's mercy and truth are reasons for worship, motivating believers to praise Him daily.
Embrace the call to share the gospel with all nations, reflecting the psalm's universal invitation to praise God.
Trust in God's enduring truth as a foundation for faith and obedience in every circumstance.

keyVerses.text: O praise the LORD, all ye nations: praise him, all ye people.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the universal call to worship God, transcending ethnic and national boundaries.

keyVerses.text: For his merciful kindness is great toward us: and the truth of the LORD endureth for ever. Praise ye the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals the reasons for praise—God’s steadfast love and eternal faithfulness—encouraging continual worship.
